result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm

records.addlTxt:
8:20 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant pleads not guilty, all counts. ADA Ellenwood requests time to review case and notes there is a pending file in Branch III. Court requests motions to be filed by 1/5/2023. Address confirmed and bond continues. sf
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Order for payment on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:03 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court w/Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm. V/W present w/victim and others. S/T Officer Alexander Weiske, Village of Somerset PD; direct by Atty Rockow. Court reflects identity of the DE. Atty Rockow asks the Court to take judicial notice of the Bond in SCC case 22CF188, Atty Dobbe objects, Court reserves. Cross by Atty Dobbe. Re-direct by Atty Rockow. Re-cross by Atty Dobbe. Court takes up issue of judicial notice of bond in 22CF188, refers to statute and does take judicial notice of that bond. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues. Adjourned: 3:20 pm
Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on October 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

9:05 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court w/Defendant Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm. Atty Dobbe was recently appointed, waives time limits on PH. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues. Adjourned: 9:07 am
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:02 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm in court.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE states he'd like a court-appointed atty and states Atty White is court-appointed on other matter (22CF188), but Atty White told DE that he didn't have time to take on this case as well. Court reviews PFAC in 22CF188. DE states he's currently unemployed, but will be shortly. DE will need to complete new PFAC since his employment has changed. Off record at 3:08 PM. Recalled at 3:20 PM. Prosecuting attorney Holly Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. All appearances as previously stated. Court questions DE regarding employment. Court finds DE qualifies for court-appointed atty program. Court orders DE to pay $50/mo commencing 11/1/22. DE states pictures have been taken during court and posted on social media. ADA Rockow doesn't know anything about that. Court advises that there are no photos or recordings allowed in the courtroom and this is a court of law. Court sets STC to allow time for atty to be court-appointed. DE updates address and phone number. gll

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, E.J.B. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:20 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson,  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt and Intern Lanie Krause in court, Defendant Shane Dwayne Sedahl-Sahm in court in custody via video. DE received copy of complaint. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. DE does not qualify for public defender. Atty. Nick White was court appointed on other pending case. Court will appoint same attorney if accepted. Bond arguments. Court sets bond. Court sets STC for attorney status. Adjourned: 1:26 PM. kma
